Just to clear up something that was mentioned at the beginning, sake is NOT rice wine! I wish the Science channel did a little more research before continuing this misconception. Its a brewed beverage(also not distilled)but its process is unlike any other because it undergoes a process known as multiple parallel fermentation. This means that the conversion of starch to sugar happens at the same time as sugar to alcohol, which does not happen in any other alcoholic beverage.
Drinking sake right now! Really amazing process and great drink!

Fun fact! If you order "sake" in Japan, you'll most likely be given beer. Why? Because the name of the drink that everyone knows as "sake, is "nihonshu" in Japanese. "Sake" refers to alcohol in general!
